title: Drawing, "Sketches from Calé, Colombia", July 1853
medium: Graphite on white wove paper, folded
description:
Left half: sketch of a part of the town with the landscape background, into which "plain" and "2's" are inscribed. 

Written on top: 
"the tops of the 
mountains are of a superb rose
line- and the clouds back (?) above and
before the mountains are more orange.

Bottom:
looking East at sunset
2 Lower part of the mountains
fine cool gray blue. Open sky
....ing (?) to orange or green with
reversed rasp more blue, with
a snow peak the effect would have
been superb
Cali July 53

Right half, top, vertically: "A  hut"
Caption: "Cale - 53". 
Bottom: sketched coconut palms, written on top: 
"Cocoanut trees
wind"

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sketches from Calé, Colombia", July 1853.
July 1853. Graphite on white wove paper, folded. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-1339.
